version_description:
• Fixed iOS 6 specific critical bugs

For the best WeMo experience, please make sure all phones/devices have the latest app.

Feedback? Tell us what you think at wemohelp@belkin.com.

• Fixed iOS 6 specific critical bugs

For the best WeMo experience, please make sure all phones/devices have the latest app.

Feedback? Tell us what you think at wemohelp@belkin.com.

• Auto-off Timer rule for Switch, Insight, and Light Switch
• Support for additional IFTTT actions for WEMO Maker
• Enhancements to WEMO responsiveness in homes with range extenders, access points, and multi-band routers
• Improvements to LED smart bulb firmware upgrade process
• General bug fixes and improvements

• Auto-off Timer rule for Switch, Insight, and Light Switch
• Support for additional IFTTT actions for WEMO Maker
• Enhancements to WEMO responsiveness in homes with range extenders, access points, and multi-band routers
• Improvements to LED smart bulb firmware upgrade process
• General bug fixes and improvements
·    Addressed an issue where fully functional LED smart bulbs are not detected during setup with older versions of WEMO Link firmware
·    Addressed an issue where fully functional LED smart bulbs are not detected during setup with older versions of WEMO Link firmware

What’s new:
• Always set the mood. Control color and temperature of OSRAM LIGHTIFY LED bulbs (Flex RGBW, Gardenspot Mini RGB, Tunable White 60).
• Go beyond automation. Create your own IFTTT recipes for OSRAM LIGHTIFY and WeMo LED bulbs. Use texts, tweets, even touchdowns to turn lights on or off.
• Join the community. See how others are using WeMo to make their lives a little better. Directly access from the app so you can learn and contribute to WeMo culture.

What’s better:
• Speed and reliability of discovery of WeMo products.

What’s gone:
• A bunch of annoying bugs.

Get in touch:
• Send us feedback at wemohelp@belkin.com . If you love WeMo don't forget to rate us in the app store

• Implemented 64-bit compliance throughout whole app architecture
• Optimized rules engine for speed and flexibility
• Reduced time it takes to load rules tab
• Improved reliability and speed of displaying your paired WeMo products
• Additional IFTTT triggers and actions for OSRAM Lightify products (Garden Spot, A19 Tunable White, Flex Strip)
• Added support for Holmes® Large Room Smart Humidifier
• Improved method of reporting problems and feedback to WeMo Customer Advocacy team

• Implemented 64-bit compliance throughout whole app architecture
• Optimized rules engine for speed and flexibility
• Reduced time it takes to load rules tab
• Improved reliability and speed of displaying your paired WeMo products
• Additional IFTTT triggers and actions for OSRAM Lightify products (Garden Spot, A19 Tunable White, Flex Strip)
• Added support for Holmes® Large Room Smart Humidifier
• Improved method of reporting problems and feedback to WeMo Customer Advocacy team

We don’t mean to get your heart pounding, but it’s time once again for an update to the WeMo app. Alluringly dubbed v1.13.4, this update contains a bevy of fixes and improvements:

• We fixed issues that caused WeMo devices to occasionally fail to appear in the WeMo app.
• We fixed some memory leaks in the WeMo device firmware.
• You can now use passwords longer than 45 characters in your home network. For a handful of folks with impressively long network passwords, we created a very inconvenient situation with our previous updates. We regret that.
• Issues with the wrong number of LED bulbs being indicated, or bulbs being inexplicably grayed out, have been fixed. You’ll be glad to know we have also repaired the “fade in” function in your rules so the bulbs don’t snap on, terrifying you and exacerbating hangovers.
• New product support! WeMo now works with Cree Connected LED Bulbs. All week we’ve been running around the office yelling, “CREEEEEEEE!!!” (Try it.)

This is one of many upcoming releases that are part of a concerted effort to improve the WeMo experience. We’ve been reaching out to our users directly to get feedback on what could be improved, and we invite you to participate in that conversation at:

http://community.wemothat.com

Thank you for supporting us, and for your patience with our process.

Just a small year-end update to spike your nog. January will bring variable flurries and a bigger release to warm your cockles.
• WeMo devices now reliably stay in sync when enabling and disabling Remote capability.
• Selecting “NetCam” in your WeMo app now does the thing where it opens the NetCam app.
• WeMo app no longer wantonly and unnecessarily updates the NetCam during a firmware update.
• Firmware update status messages used to be occasionally hinky, and we have unhinked them.

Just a small year-end update to spike your nog. January will bring variable flurries and a bigger release to warm your cockles.
• WeMo devices now reliably stay in sync when enabling and disabling Remote capability.
• Selecting “NetCam” in your WeMo app now does the thing where it opens the NetCam app.
• WeMo app no longer wantonly and unnecessarily updates the NetCam during a firmware update.
• Firmware update status messages used to be occasionally hinky, and we have unhinked them.

No trip to Cabo for us. We spent the holidays up to our jingle bells in code, working over the WEMO app and firmware. We’ll continue to improve the WEMO experience in the months to come, but here are a host of fixes to ring in the new year:

iOS Performance Improvements
• Improved device presentation, typography, and drawer behavior in the device list.
• New year’s resolution: fewer crashes, random spinners and gray-outs.
• Buttons respond faster.
• Fixed a rare issue that causes Sunrise Offset to get lost.

Firmware Update Improvements
• Streamlined the downloading process.
• Made firmware update check less intrusive.
• Fixed a rare case in which the app crashes while upgrading the firmware.
• Fixed an issue that caused update pop-ups to appear for devices no longer in use.

WEMO Link Improvements
• Overall accuracy has been improved for LEDs in both local and remote mode.
• Reduced LEDs lagging behind other WEMO devices in appearing in the app.
• You can now go to town creating LED rules in remote mode.

No trip to Cabo for us. We spent the holidays up to our jingle bells in code, working over the WEMO app and firmware. We’ll continue to improve the WEMO experience in the months to come, but here are a host of fixes to ring in the new year:

iOS Performance Improvements
• Improved device presentation, typography, and drawer behavior in the device list.
• New year’s resolution: fewer crashes, random spinners and gray-outs.
• Buttons respond faster.
• Fixed a rare issue that causes Sunrise Offset to get lost.

Firmware Update Improvements
• Streamlined the downloading process.
• Made firmware update check less intrusive.
• Fixed a rare case in which the app crashes while upgrading the firmware.
• Fixed an issue that caused update pop-ups to appear for devices no longer in use.

WEMO Link Improvements
• Overall accuracy has been improved for LEDs in both local and remote mode.
• Reduced LEDs lagging behind other WEMO devices in appearing in the app.
• You can now go to town creating LED rules in remote mode.

Chocolate and peanut butter. Wine and cheese. Netflix and chill. Some things just go better together. So we’re REALLY excited to announce that, as of this update, Wemo works with Nest Learning Thermostat™. Woot!

Aside from that little detail, we made these fixes and improvements:

• Abbiamo localizzato l'applicazione per la lingua Italiana. (Sexy.)
• Fixed an app crash related to the user having a Crockpot in the device list. (Not sexy.)
• Fixed an issue that caused a “Wemo lost connection” message to appear when app connects to router during setup.
• Eliminated an irritating situation where the Insight Drawer keeps showing “calculating…”
• Reduced the number of times Insight will try to connect to the cloud if there’s an error.
• App no longer lies to you about unplugged LED bulbs being “available.”

Did we mention that Wemo now works with Nest?!

Chocolate and peanut butter. Wine and cheese. Netflix and chill. Some things just go better together. So we’re REALLY excited to announce that, as of this update, Wemo works with Nest Learning Thermostat™. Woot!

Aside from that little detail, we made these fixes and improvements:

• Abbiamo localizzato l'applicazione per la lingua Italiana. (Sexy.)
• Fixed an app crash related to the user having a Crockpot in the device list. (Not sexy.)
• Fixed an issue that caused a “Wemo lost connection” message to appear when app connects to router during setup.
• Eliminated an irritating situation where the Insight Drawer keeps showing “calculating…”
• Reduced the number of times Insight will try to connect to the cloud if there’s an error.
• App no longer lies to you about unplugged LED bulbs being “available.”

Did we mention that Wemo now works with Nest?!

Hi there. For this update, we put a new coat of paint on our user interface. Things should feel a little fresher generally, and we finally got the stain out of the carpet where Dave threw up that time. Metaphorically speaking.

Seriously, though, we’ve made some nice accessibility improvements for the sight-impaired, including voice feedback in the device list.

We made minor changes to set-up flow and e-mail collection—no biggie.

More important, we fixed an issue where freshly launching the app in remote mode and then later using the app in local mode (while chewing gum and counting backwards) slowly eroded the reliability of device discovery. So you can do that now, but without the wonkiness.

Thanks as always for your support and encouragement.

-Team Wemo

Hey, everybody. This’ll be quick: This update ensures the Wemo app runs smoothly on iOS 10. We also fixed some Nest authentication problems created by iOS 9.3.4 for those of you who aren’t psychologically prepared for iOS to enter double digits.

That’s it! Enjoy.

Hey, everybody. This’ll be quick: This update ensures the Wemo app runs smoothly on iOS 10. We also fixed some Nest authentication problems created by iOS 9.3.4 for those of you who aren’t psychologically prepared for iOS to enter double digits.

That’s it! Enjoy.

If your walls have been colonized by one or more Wemo Light Switches, we’ve got some good news for you. With this update, we've given the Light Switch a superpower, called “Long Press.” With the Long Press feature, you can set any number of other Wemos to respond to a two-second press of the Light Switch. Maybe you want Long Press to turn all your Wemos off. Or turn all of them on. Or put the light switch into “Randomize Lights” mode when you leave for the day. If you’ve got a Wemo light switch and two seconds, you've got a lot of options.

The times they are a-changin’. Let’s get your WeMo App happy and healthy for changes in the new iOS 10.2 beta.

Code Red firmware update has arrived.

The latest firmware release includes iOS beta 10.2 compatibility improvements and significant fixes to the Rules page.

Thank you, Wemo Community, for helping us improve your experience.

Thank you, Wemo Community, for helping us improve your experience.

This update supports our much anticipated Wemo Mini product launch. What’s Mini? Boasting a sleek new form-factor, the Wemo Mini Smart Plug is a next generation smart plug that gives you control of your lamps and electronic devices whenever you want, wherever you choose, with tons of options for scheduling and automation. Learn more at wemo.com

We also fixed some iOS 10.2 bugs and general fixes to improve your experience.

That’s it! Enjoy.

This app release provides some general enhancements and improves the setup experience for our new Wemo Mini smart plug.

Visit Wemo.com for more information on Wemo Mini. Download the new release today and enjoy your improved Wemo experience.

Wemo app spring cleaning is in full swing. This release enhances functionality and performance of your Wemo devices. Download today and enjoy a better Wemo experience.

Get ready for a better Wemo app experience. This app release provides overall enhancements and improves setup. We’ve also squashed a few bugs that may have messed with your Wemo rules and Wemo Dimmer.

Download and enjoy the new release today!

Let’s get your Wemo app happy and healthy. This app release fixes a few hiccups we found with setting up your Wemo devices.

Download and enjoy the new release today!

Let’s get you ready for the upcoming and much anticipated launch of the Wemo Bridge which will lets you control your Wemo smart plugs and light switches with the Apple Home app and Siri from your iPhone, iPad, or Apple Watch. Set the mood for movie night or ask Siri to start your morning and lights gently turn on and coffee starts to brew.

We’re also showing some love to all those iPhone X users out there to improve your Wemo app experience.

Download and enjoy the new release today!

Thanks for your feedback. We keep working to make Wemo more intuitive, more powerful and, hopefully, more fun.

This time, you get a bunch of improvements to how Wemo works with Nest and the Apple Home app, bundled with the elimination of miscellaneous annoying popups and crashes.

With this app release Wemo now supports Apple HomeKit for Wemo Mini Smart Plugs with no bridge required! Download the app release, and keep an eye out for an important firmware update that will enable Apple HomeKit support on Wemo Mini devices.

With this app release Wemo now supports Apple HomeKit for Wemo Mini Smart Plugs with no bridge required! Download the app release, and keep an eye out for an important firmware update that will enable Apple HomeKit support on Wemo Mini devices.

With this app update we've added instructions for how to connect your Wemo to the Google Assistant. We've also fixed a few critical bugs including:
· Recurring Home Data permission requests
· Device order being reset in device list
· Crockpot state issues
· Light Bulb sleep timer issues

In Wemo 1.23 we've added language support for Traditional Chinese. We've also tracked down and fixed several critical defects including:
· Temperature display issues for Holmes Heater
· App crashes when creating schedule rules

You can now connect your Wemo Dimmers to Apple Homekit, no bridge required! Get the app, and look out for a new firmware that will make your Dimmers say Hello Homekit! We've also added the ability to check for firmware updates at any time, localizations for new features, and fixed several critical bugs including:

· Dimmer bulb calibration crashes
· Nest tile displaying incorrect temperatures

This update adds support for the new Wemo Light Switch 3-Way. We also fixed a few things that were causing some users trouble with rules. Keep sending us feedback and we’ll keep working to make things better.

This update adds support for the brand new Wemo Light Switch. We also added security enhancements to the Wemo Wi-Fi setup process. Keep sending us feedback and we’ll keep working to make things better.

In this update we fixed a bug causing the Wemo app to crash when accessing the Rules tab.

With this update we made sure the app is compatible with the upcoming iOS 14 release. We also made changes to eliminate the requirement to allow location permission for those who've created a Wemo account. You can learn more about Wemo and location permission at our support site - belkin.com/us/support-article?articleNum=316350.

In this update we tracked down and fixed several bugs to improve Wemo accounts. We also added support for password managers. You can now use saved credentials from these password managers when creating and logging into your Wemo account.

In this update we tracked down and fixed several bugs to improve Wemo accounts. We also added support for password managers. You can now use saved credentials from these password managers when creating and logging into your Wemo account.
In this update we fixed a bug that was blocking Wemo rules with time schedules from working.
In this update we fixed a bug that was blocking Wemo rules with time schedules from working.

We made some important improvements to Wemo Accounts! A bug was fixed that was causing some users to be persistently logged out. We also added support for Apple Face ID and Touch ID. Now you can sign in to access your Wemos much faster. Head to your account settings to turn this feature on.
